column4: you can use 'gksudo displayconfig-gtk' to set up your monitor
great thanks

Hi me with the monitor again, I couldn't find my monitor in displayconfig-gtk so i choose one that sounded similar and changed the minor refresh rate differences but X won't load the correct resolution. Is there a way to create the modelines for my monitor by hand ? google can't find any either
there is, but that would be skipping ahead. I suggest you look at /var/log/Xorg.0.log and see if any reason is reported why Xorg discards the resolutions you want.

I see that i thinks i got a virtual size of 1920x1080 but i want 1920x1200 as my resolution, i changed the virtual size from 1920x1200 to 0 0 in xorg.conf because i wanted to login, i could not see the login prompt if i didn't set it to "0 0". I get a bunch of warnings like this though "(WW) AIGLX: 3D driver claims to not support visual 0x23"
I don't think that warning is relevant -- I see it all the time in the absence of any problems
anything specific i should look of in the xorg.0.log file ?
you don't see any messages about it discarding modes?
it doesn't event consider the resolution i want 1920x1080 is the highest ones it lists
it may be a dumb question, but does your monitor support 1920x1200?
yes if i use a "empty" Screen section in xorg.conf it chooses 1920x1200 :)
so why don't you do that?
because then i get horizontal flickery when i play movies
I'm not sure, but I don't think you're addressing this problem in the right way by playing with the X setup. What video player are you using?

I have been testing VLC, MPlayer and Totem all with different video output and with the same result. The only thing that has worked is setting "Option "TexturedVideo" "off"" in xorg.conf but then the picture gets all pixely and looks even worse then before
which driver?
ATI Catalyst 8.51.3
sorry, I don't think I'll be able to help with your issue
ok, do you know where i can go to find help with this problem ?
I think you should ask in this channel. Do report your flickering problem first, because your X setup seems to be fine.
I did and i got the response that i should try and setup my monitor correctly, well thanks anyway
well, I hope the detour hasn't been totally wasteful... Now at least you know that your monitor is setup fine.
